list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The heavy rainfall turned the land into a marsh.

list_ex_of_english: The marshes in my area could be at risk.
Pit heaps, marshes, water and flashes of water are all part of our inheritance from deep mining in the past.
I have brought back tapes, photographs and videos taken at great risk of life and limb by people deep inside the heart of the marshes.
The owner also has on marshes about one mile distant eleven cattle and one calf.
Under his direction, marshes were drained, a hospital founded, courts of judicature set up, and an assembly of landowners convened to regulate local taxes and other sources of revenue.
He has other plans to rip up the marshes, which are sites of special scientific interest.
What percentage of the marshes is at present arable land?
If a scheme could be devised to protect these marshes which was both technically and economically sound, we would certainly consider it for grant aid.
